notes: The Red Wings announced Compher as Out for Monday's (Jan. 27) game against the Kings.

Bastian did not return to Monday's (Jan. 27) game against Philadelphia.

The Red Wings announced Tarasenko as OUT for Monday's (Jan. 27) game against the Kings.
Gibson did not return to Saturday's (Jan. 25) game versus the Predators.

The Pittsburgh Penguins placed F Evgeni Malkin on Injured Reserve Monday (Jan. 27).
Bahl did not play in Sunday's (Jan. 26) game against Winnipeg.
Cousins will be out for a while after sustaining an injury in Saturday's (Jan. 25) game versus the Maple Leafs, per Bruce Garrioch of Postmedia.
The New York Islanders placed D Ryan Pulock on Injured Reserve Monday (Jan. 27).
The New York Islanders placed G Marcus Hogberg on Injured Reserve Monday (Jan. 27).
The New Jersey announced Hischier as Out for Monday's (Jan. 27) game against the Flyers.
The San Jose Sharks placed F Ty Dellandrea on Injured Reserve Friday (Jan. 24)
The Flyers listed Zamula as OUT for Monday's (Jan. 27) game against New Jersey.
The New York Islanders placed D Noah Dobson on Long Term Injured Reserve Sunday (Jan. 26).
Jensen did not play in Sunday's (Jan. 26) game against Utah.
The Vegas Golden Knights placed F William Karlsson on Injured Reserve Thursday (Jan. 23).
Sherwood (undisclosed) is not traveling with the Canucks and will miss Monday's game in St. Louis, Jeff Paterson of CanucksArmy.com reports.
The Penguins listed Lizotte as OUT for Monday's (Jan. 27) game against San Jose.
The Devils announced Markstrom is expected to be out of action for 4-6 weeks after suffering a sprained MCL.
Knies did not play in Saturday's (Jan. 25) game versus the Senators.
Sillinger did not play in Saturday's (Jan. 25) game versus the Kings.
Norris is expected to miss Ottawa's next three games, according to TSN 1200 Ottawa Wednesday (Jan. 22).
The San Jose Sharks placed F Nico Sturm on Injured Reserve on Wednesday (Jan. 22).
The Toronto Maple Leafs placed F Connor Dewar on Injured Reserve on Saturday (Jan. 25).
The Detroit Red Wings placed F Patrick Kane on Injured Reserve Monday (Jan. 27).
The Toronto Maple Leafs placed F Max Pacioretty on Injured Reserve on (Jan. 22) retroactive Jan. 18.
The Boston Bruins placed F Mark Kastelic on Injured Reserve Tuesday (Jan. 21).
The Winnipeg Jets placed F Adam Lowry on injured reserve on Wednesday (Jan. 22).
Jankowski didn't practice Monday (Jan. 20) and is week-to-week, as per Brooks Bratten of the Predators.
Sergachev is Out for Sunday's (Jan. 26) game against the Ottawa, as per Belle Fraser of The Salt Lake Tribune.
The Vegas Golden Knights placed F Cole Schwindt on Injured Reserve Thursday (Jan. 23).
Koepke did not play in Saturday's (Jan. 25) game against Colorado.
The Philadelphia Flyers placed F Ryan Poehling on Injured Reserve Monday (Jan. 20).
The Vancouver Canucks placed D Noah Juulsen on injured reserve on Wednesday (Jan. 22).
The Maple Leafs announced on Tuesday (Jan. 21) that Tavares has not resumed skating and does not have a timeline to return from his lower-body injury, per Mark Masters of TSN.
The Minnesota Wild placed F Marcus Johansson on injured reserve on Thursday (Jan 16.).
The Canadiens announced Heineman was involved in a traffic accident yesterday as a pedestrian. Heineman sustained an upper-body injury and will be out 3-4 weeks.
McAvoy doesn't have a timeline for his return to the lineup, as per Andrew Fantucchio of Boston Hockey.
Reinhardt did not play in Sunday's (Jan. 26) game against Utah.
The Utah Hockey Club placed F Dylan Guenther on injured reserve on Tuesday (Jan. 14).
Kostin is working his way back to full fitness but is still not in the day-to-day category, per Sheng Peng of San Jose Hockey Now..
The Chicago Blackhawks placed F Craig Smith on Injured Reserve Thursday (Jan. 23).
The Ottawa Senators placed F Noah Gregor on the Injured Reserve Thursday (Jan. 23).
The Minnesota Wild placed D Jonas Brodin on Injured Reserve on Saturday (Jan. 18).
The Nashville Predators placed F Luke Evangelista on injured reserve on Saturday (Jan. 18).
The New York Islanders placed F Hudson Fasching on Injured Reserve on Friday (Jan. 17).
The Calgary Flames placed F Connor Zary on injured reserve on Friday (Jan. 10).
The Blue Jackets announced on Saturday (Jan. 25) that Monahan is expected to be sidelined an additional six to eight weeks due to a wrist injury.
The Ottawa Senators placed D Jacob Bernard-Docker on Injured Reserve on Friday (Jan. 10).
Head coach Sheldon Keefe relayed that Haula (ankle) is skating on his own but does not have a timetable to return, according to Catherine Bogart of the Devils' official site.
HC Rod Brind'Amour said that Carrier has undergone surgery and is facing a long-term absence, according to Chip Alexander of The Raleigh News & Observer Friday(Jan. 24).
HC Andre Tourigny said Monday (Jan. 20) that Bortuzzo is getting closer to full health but isn't yet ready to return to game action, as per Cole Bagley of KSL Sports.
The Kraken announced Gourde (lower body) doesn't have a timeline for his return to the lineup, Mike Benton of the Kraken Audio Network reports Saturday.
Petry (undisclosed) will not travel with the Red Wings for their upcoming four-game road trip and still on injured reserve since Wednesday (Jan. 8), according to Ansar Khan of MLive.com.
The Vancouver Canucks placed F Dakota Joshua on the Injured Reserve Monday (Jan. 6).
Murphy will remain unavailable for a bit, coach Anders Sorensen told Scott Powers of The Athletic on Saturday. He was also placed on injured reserve, per the NHL media site.
Jost skated with the team Sunday (Jan. 19) but will still be out indefinitely, according to Walt Ruff of the Hurricanes' official site.
Nichushkin is back to being considered week-to-week after suffering a setback, according to Evan Rawal of the Denver Gazette Wednesday (Jan. 22).
Lauzon was labeled week-to-week as a result of his lower-body injury and is still on Injured Reserve since Monday (Jan. 6), according to Robby Stanley of NHL.com.
McGinn had surgery to reconstruct his ACL and will be sidelined for 7-9 months, the Ducks announced Tuesday (Jan. 21).
Marchment participated in Tuesday's (Jan. 21) morning skate but isn't close to being ready to return to the lineup, according to Owen Newkirk of DLLS Sports.
The Ottawa Senators placed F Noah Gregor on the Injured Reserve.
Gadjovich did not play in Sunday's (Jan. 26) game against Golden Knights.
The Buffalo Sabres placed F Jordan Greenway on injured reserve on Friday (Dec. 20).

The Sharks announced on Tuesday (Jan. 21) that Vanecek could return to practice before the end of the week but the team hasn't provided a more concrete return-to-play plan, per Sheng Peng of San Jose Hockey Now.
Regula was never taken off the season-opening injured reserve despite being waived by Boston and claimed by Edmonton on Wednesday (Dec. 11), per Daniel Nugent-Bowman of The Athletic.
The Lightning said on Thursday (Dec. 19) that Moser is expected to miss 8-10 weeks with a lower body injury.
HC Berube said Friday (Jan. 24) that Stolarz is probably ahead of schedule and isn't expected to be out "a whole lot longer," as per David Alter of The Hockey News.
The Philadelphia Flyers placed F Nicolas Deslauriers on injured reserve on Friday (Dec. 6).
The New York Islanders placed G Semyon Varlamov on long-term injured reserve on Thursday (Dec. 19).

Seguin will be out of action for 4-6 months when he undergoes surgery on Thursday (Dec. 5) for a left-side femoral acetabular impingement and hip labrum, per Lia Assimakopoulos of The Dallas Morning News.
Chinakhov is still a few weeks away from a return, according to Mark Scheig of The Hockey Writers.
The Flames announced that Kirkland underwent successful ACL surgery on Wednesday (Dec. 4) and he will be out for the remainder of the season.

The Avalanche announced Kylington isn't expected to join the Avalanche on their upcoming three-game road trip, which begins Saturday in Boston, according to Evan Rawal of the Denver Gazette Thursday (Jan. 23).
The Maple Leafs placed D Jani Hakanpaa on long-term injured reserve on Tuesday (Dec. 31).

The Kraken announced on Wednesday (Jan. 22) that Eberle has resumed workouts and light skating in his recovery from a pelvic surgery but not close to return yet, per Curtis Crabtree of Fox 13 Seattle.
The Boston Bruins placed D Hampus Lindholm on Long Term Injured Reserve Tuesday (Jan. 14).
Milano took part in Wednesday's (Jan. 15) practice though he was wearing a non-contact jersey and is still on long-term injured reserve since Wednesday (Nov. 20), per Tom Gulitti of NHL.com.
The Flames announced that Mantha will require surgery on his ACL on Thursday (Nov. 14) and will miss the remainder of the 2024-25 season.
Reilly (heart procedure) has been placed on LTIR on Tuesday (Jan. 7). He will be out indefinitely.
Leddy doesn't have a timetable for his return to the lineup, and still remains on injured reserve as of Tuesday (Jan. 7), per Matthew DeFranks of the St. Louis Post-Dispatch.
The Blue Jackets announced Gudbranson (shoulder) isn't expected to return until the end of March, Mark Scheig of The Hockey Writers reports Saturday.
"There's a good chance" Durzi will be able to return in April, coach Andre Tourigny told Cole Bagley of KSL Sports on Wednesday (Jan. 15).
The Colorado Avalanche placed D Tucker Poolman on long-term injured reserve. He didn't play in 2023-24 due to migraines and won't be available for the 2024-25 campaign either.
The Vegas Golden Knights placed D Lukas Cormier on injured reserve non-roster list on Tuesday (Oct. 8).
The Philadelphia Flyers placed D Ryan Ellis on injured reserve on Monday (Oct. 7).
Jenner skated before practice on Saturday (Jan. 25) but his return could occur when the team goes to action after the 4 Nations Face-Off, per Mark Scheig of The Hockey Writers.
Jarnkrok will be re-evaluated in two weeks to determine a clearer recovery timeline, according to David Alter of The Hockey News.

Grosenick underwent successful surgery on Wednesday (Oct. 2) to repair a torn ACL in his right knee and will not play this season. He is expected to make a full recovery and be ready for the start of the 2025-26 season.
The Canadiens said that Reinbacher underwent surgery to his left knee on Tuesday (Oct. 1) and is out for 5-to-6 months.
The Nashville Predators placed F Austin Roest on injured reserve non-roster list on Sunday (Sept. 29).
The Devils said that Hatakka underwent successful shoulder surgery on Thursday (Oct. 10) and is without a timetable to return.
Doughty was working in a regular sweater Wednesday (Jan. 22) and will travel with the Kings for their upcoming five-game road trip, according to Dennis Bernstein of The Fourth Period.
Couture has not resumed skating on Friday (Nov. 1) and remains without a timeline to return, per Sheng Peng of San Jose Hockey Now.

The Capitals said on Wednesday (Sept. 18) that Oshie will be put on long-term injured reserve due to a chronic back injury which is expected to cost him the entire 2024-25 campaign, per Tom Gulitti of NHL.com.
The Oilers announced that Kane underwent successful knee surgery on Thursday (Jan. 9) and is expected to be sidelined for another 4-8 weeks.
The St. Louis Blues placed D Torey Krug on long-term injured reserve on Tuesday (Oct. 8).
The Hurricanes announced that Fast is out for the 2024-2025 season as he recovers from neck surgery.
Brossoit had another procedure done on Friday (Nov. 29) and is expected to be out for another six weeks, according to Blackhawks head coach Luke Richardson.
The Washington Capitals placed F Nicklas Backstrom on long-term injured reserve.
Avalanche head coach Jared Bednar said on Thursday (Jan. 2) that Landeskog remains without a timetable to return, as per Corey Masisak of The Denver Post.
